info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Williamson County through 430 PM CST... At 359 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Goreville, or 8 miles south of Carterville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lake Of Egypt Area around 405 PM CST. Crainville and Energy around 410 PM CST. Marion around 415 PM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Johnston City and Pittsburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois near Mile Marker 1. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 44 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
